page.title: 07THE OXFORD MEADS
page.content: Oxey Mead and Pixey Mead have been designated sites of special scientific interest because they are water meadows which have never been ploughed.As a result of this there are over thirty rare species of flowers including early purple orchid, adder's tongue fern, meadow buttercup and a late flowering dandelion found nowhere else.Hay is gathered annually in early July to allow the rare plants to seed. The names derive from ancient Saxon times.Pic and Oc were farmers who owned these two islands,island being "ey" in Saxon.
